skill.name: changelog
skill.description: Maintains IdeaVim changelog (CHANGES.md) and build.gradle.kts changeNotes. Use when updating changelog, documenting releases, or reviewing commits/PRs for changelog entries.
skill.summary: Maintains IdeaVim changelog (CHANGES.md) and build.gradle.kts changeNotes. Use when updating changel...
skill.author: JetBrains

security_audit.summary: Only a single instruction file is present and it describes changelog workflows. No code execution, network calls, or sensitive data access patterns are defined.

content.value_statement: Keeping release notes consistent across files is time consuming. This skill guides you to update CHANGES.md and changeNotes in a synchronized, user focused way.
actual_capabilities: Identify the latest documented version and the To Be Released section
Collect commits and PRs since the last documented release
Apply inclusion and exclusion rules for changelog entries
Format entries with correct sections, links, and ticket references
Convert changelog entries into changeNotes HTML format
limitations: Works only for IdeaVim changelog conventions
Requires repository access to CHANGES.md and build.gradle.kts
Does not infer details when code or tests do not reveal user impact
Avoids logging API module changes while marked experimental

use_cases.title: Prepare a new release
use_cases.description: Compile and format changelog entries for the next version and keep changeNotes synchronized.

use_cases.title: Review recent PRs
use_cases.description: Filter merged PRs and extract user facing changes with proper references and formatting.

use_cases.title: Draft a changelog update
use_cases.description: Create a clean To Be Released section that matches current commits and excludes noise.

prompt_templates.title: Update To Be Released
prompt_templates.prompt: Review recent commits and suggest To Be Released entries with Features, Fixes, and Changes. Follow IdeaVim changelog rules.

prompt_templates.title: Sync changeNotes
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert the current To Be Released section into build.gradle.kts changeNotes HTML with correct links and code formatting.

prompt_templates.title: PR focused update
prompt_templates.prompt: Use merged PRs and commit details to draft changelog entries, excluding dependabot and internal refactors.

prompt_templates.title: Release audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare tags, commits, and CHANGES.md to identify missing releases and required entries, then propose updates.

output_examples.input: Summarize new user facing fixes since the last release and format them for CHANGES.md.
output: Add a Fixes section entry for the corrected visual mode cursor behavior with the VIM ticket link
Include a Fixes entry describing the specific command that now works correctly
Exclude internal refactors and test only changes

best_practices: Use commit diffs and tests to capture user visible behavior changes
Keep entries concise and in past tense with clear command examples
Mirror the To Be Released content exactly in changeNotes HTML
anti_patterns: Logging API module changes while it is experimental
Adding vague entries without a clear user impact
Duplicating the same change across multiple sections

faq.question: Is this compatible with other projects?
faq.answer: No. It targets IdeaVim changelog structure and JetBrains plugin changeNotes formatting.

faq.question: What are the content limits?
faq.answer: Entries should be concise, one line per change when possible, and only user visible items.

faq.question: Does it integrate with GitHub workflows?
faq.answer: Yes. It references git log and gh pr list commands commonly used in CI workflows.

faq.question: Does it access sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. It focuses on repository files and standard git metadata.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot missing entries?
faq.answer: Check recent commits and tests, and verify the last documented version and tags.

faq.question: How does it compare to a generic changelog tool?
faq.answer: It is specialized for IdeaVim rules, links, and changeNotes formatting.
